Story.title: Naomi: Ballad of the Overachiever
Story.Description: As head of the Prom Planning Committee, Naomi's job is to ensure a magical evening for the greater student body. But while transforming the gym into a crepe paper paradise, a thought: there's nothing in the prom charter bylaws stopping Naomi from running for Prom Queen herself. It's always been her dream... maybe it's time for this overseer to finally be seen?

GoalDescription.words: Naomi has always endeavored to do nice things for others... wouldn't it be wonderful if something nice happened to her for once?

taskNaturalLanguage.words: Make four nice things happen to Naomi ###NAOMI###

GoalDescription.words: That foreign exchange student Gunter doesn't seem to have a whole lot of friends. The prom won't be magical for Naomi unless it's magical for everyone. Get him some friends.

taskNaturalLanguage.words: Have Naomi ###NAOMI### become friends with Gunter ###GUNTER###
Get Gunter ###GUNTER### to have at least three friends. ###FRIENDS###

GoalDescription.words: Sometimes it feels like everyone in this school is just so mean. Naomi asks, can't we all just get along?

taskNaturalLanguage.words: Make Naomi ###NAOMI### do three generally nice things
Make Zack ###ZACK### do three generally nice things
Make Lucas ###LUCAS### do three generally nice things

GoalDescription.words: Buzz is cheating on Naomi. Destroy him.

taskNaturalLanguage.words: Have Naomi ###NAOMI### stop dating ###NOT DATING### Buzz ###BUZZ###
Ensure that Buzz ###BUZZ### is not dating anyone
Have six people think Buzz ###BUZZ### is a total doofus ###COOL DOWN###
Make three generally negative things happen to Buzz ###BUZZ###

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Gunter, I'm not sure if you realize this since you're new around here... but I've been working towards making this night perfect all year
It's always been my dream to make this a night to remember for everyone, but I kinda feel like I didn't *really* start living prom week for *me* until just a couple days ago.
But I guess that just wasn't enough time...
I mean, I worked *so hard* for these people, and I couldn't even get them to be nice to me at all.
Heh, you know Gunter, I even had a secret plan to try to get you elected as prom king.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Well, that worked out great, didn't it.
In my country, we have a word for people who spend all their lives trying to please others at the sacrifice of pleasing themselves.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Yeah... there's a lot of wisdom in that. I think.
Attention everyone! Hey! Can I get everyone's attention, please?
We're about to announce who the prom queen is...
I'm so excited! And the prom queen is.... OMG.
IT'S ME! IT'S ME! *I'M* the Prom Queen!
I... I'm speechless!
I never would have dreamed in a million years that *I* would be the one wearing the little crown!
But what really touches me is the fact that I was voted in by my peers! It's because of *you* that I'm here today! Thank you!
Thank you. Thank you for making this night the greatest night of my entire life.
I better go mingle with my subjects, now! Duty calls!
Gunter! I'm glad I ran into you!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Yes! It is a pleasure of mine to have runned into you too!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: The results are in and.... you're the Prom King!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Oh! That is what you are don't saying? How wonderful! What is Prom King?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: What's Prom King?!? It's... it's... it means you won. It means you won high school.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: High school here is a competition?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Well... yeah. Sorta. I guess. I mean, I saw you make new friends this week. Doesn't that make you feel like a winner?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I feel like a winner all the time.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Well, congratulations Gunter. I hope that everybody back home will be proud of you.
Thanks, Cassandra.

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: I was debating coming tonight, but I'm glad I showed up. You did a really good job with this, Naomi.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: The energy in the room is just so, like...

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Well... thanks guys. I definitely worked really hard to try to make this night special for everyone.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: It really shows! People really seem to be getting along!

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: That's a small miracle at this school.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Tny miracles are what the prom is all about!
That and getting nice prom dresses!
Oh. Buzz. Hello.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Uhhhhh, I haven't heard who's prom king yet.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Hmm, let me double check my tallies...
Why... this is simply shocking!
Oh, to answer your question, no, you're not prom king, but that wasn't the shocking part. Frankly it was to be expected.
What's shocking is that you *did* win as a write-in candidate in a write-in category.
Congratulations, Buzz! You're the official Prom %pejorative%!
Disappointed? Don't worry! After learning that you were cheating on me, I figured you might have been cheating on other things too!
I did some sleuthing in between prom committee meetings, and learned that you've been plagiarizing Simon for years!
After a short chat with the principal, we both agreed that it would be for the best if you were held back a year.
Good luck with your prom campaign next year! We'll write to you from college. Or not. Goodbye forever, prom %pejorative%!
